Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal enegy, realised through The grace of divine preceptor.
I bow before the primeval Lord who has been told as the primordial cause of all.

lines.gurmukhi: so siqgur scw vysu sbid is\\\\wixAw
lines.transliteration_english: So Satiguru Sachaa Vaysu Sabadi Siaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Truth incarnate that true Guru is realised through the Word.
Only they have realised Him whose surati (consciousness) has merged into the truth after accepting the commands of the Word.
Holy congregation is the genuine basis and authentic abode of truth.
Wherein the individual inspired by loving devotion enjoys the innate delight.
Lord, kind to the devotees and the glory of the poor, also assimilates Himself in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhysu AMqu n jwixAw
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Antu N Jaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even Brahma, Visnu, Mahesa could not know His mysteries.

lines.gurmukhi: ismir shis Px sysu iqlu n pCwixAw
lines.transliteration_english: Simari Sahasi Dhan Saysu Tilu N Pachhaaniaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sesanag remembering Him with its thousand hoods could not understand Him.
The truth is pleasing to those gurmukhs who have become dervish at the door of holy congregation.
Guru and disciple

lines.gurmukhi: gur cyly rhrwis AlKu AByau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Chaylay Raharaasi Alakhu Abhayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ways of the Guru and the disciple are mysterious and imperceptible.

lines.gurmukhi: guru cyly swbwis nwnk dyau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Chaylay Saabaasi Naanak Dayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru (Nanak) and disciple (Angad) both are blest (because both have merged into each other).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq shij invwsu isPiq smyau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Sahaji Nivaasu Sidhati Samayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Their abode is the wisdom of Guru and they both are rapt in the praises of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: sbid suriq prgws ACl ACyau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Paragaas Achhal Achhayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enlightened with the Word their consciousness has become infinite and immutable.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Aws inrws miq ArKyau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Aas Niraas Mati Arakhayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Transcending all hopes they have assimilated subtle wisdom in their person.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kroD ivxwsu isPiq smyau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Karodh Vinaasu Sidhati Samayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering the lust and anger they have absorbed themselves in the praises (of God).

lines.gurmukhi: siq sMqoK aulws skiq n syau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Santokh Ulaas Sakati N Sayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beyond the abodes of Siva and Sakti they have reached the abode of truth, contentment and  bliss.

lines.gurmukhi: Gr hI ivic audwsu scu sucyau hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Hee Vichi Udaasu Sachu Souchayu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being indifferent to household (pleasures) they are truth-oriented.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh AiBAws gur isK dyau hY ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Abhiaasu Gur Sikh Dayu Hai ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru and disciple have now attain the ratio of twenty and twenty One, i.e.the disciple has gone ahead of the Guru.
Guru and disciple
The disciple who obeys the commands of the Guru is called gurmukh.
The actions of  the gurmukh are awe-inspiring and their glory is indescribable.
Considering creation as the form of the Creator he feels to be a sacrifice unto it.
In the world he feels himself as a guest and the world a guest house.
Truth is his real Guru whom he speaks and listens to.
Like a  bard, at the doors of the holy congregation, he recites the hymns of the Guru (gurbani).
For him the holy congregation is the basis of his acquaintance with the omniscient Lord.
His consciousness remains absorbed in the graceful true Word.
True court of justice for him is the holy congregation and through Word the true identity of it he establishes in his heart.
Guru and disciple

lines.gurmukhi: sbdu gurU guru vwhu gurmuiK pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadu Guroo Guru Vaahu Guramoukhi Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From the Guru the disciple obtains the wondrous Word
And as a disciple, merging his consciousness in it, comes face to face with imperceptible Lord.
Meeting the Guru, the disciple attains turia, the fourth and final stage  of spiritual quietude.
He holds unfathomable and serene Lord dearly in his heart.
Becoming carefree that true disciple merges himself in the truth.
And by becoming the king of kings he makes others subservient to him.
Only he loves the divine will of the Lord.
And only he has tasted the nectar in the form of praises of the Lord.
Taking consciousness into the depth of Word he has shaped the unchiselled mind.
The gurmukh-wayfarer

lines.gurmukhi: muil n imlY Amolu n kImiq pweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Muli N Milai Amolu N Keemati Paaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of life of gurmukhs is invaluable;

lines.gurmukhi: pwie qrwjU qol n Aqulu qulweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Paai Taraajoo Tolu N Atulu Tulaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: It cannot be purchased; on weighing scale it cannot be weighed.

lines.gurmukhi: inj Gir qKqu Afolu n folu folweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Nij Ghari Takhatu Adolu N Doli Dolaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Stabilizing in one’s own self and not getting frivolous in his way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQ inrolu n rly rlweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pand Nirolu N Ralay Ralaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This way is distinct and does not become defiled even when joined with some one else.

lines.gurmukhi: kQw AkQ Abol n bol bulweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Kadaa Akad Abolu N Bol Bulaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its story is indescribable.

lines.gurmukhi: sdw ABulu ABol n Boil BulweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Sadaa Abhulu Abholu N Bholi Bhulaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This way transcends all ommissions and all anxieties.
Absorbed in equipoise this gurmukh-way of life gives balance to life.
The gurmukh quaffs from  the tank of nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: lK tolI ieku tolu n Awpu gxweIAY ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Tolee Ik Tolu N Aapu Ganaaeeai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: The end result of lacs of experiences is the gurmukh  never exhibits his ego.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 gur is`KI dw sOdw qy KyqI

Shabad OS B.translation: The merchandise of a gursikh
From the shop of holy congregation, through the Word, the merchandise of God’s name is procured.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrw pUry vit ik AwiK slwhIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooraa Pooray Vati Ki Aakhi Salaaheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How to praise Him? The measuring criteria of  the perfect Lord are perfect.

lines.gurmukhi: kdy n hovY Git scI piqswhIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaday N Hovai Ghati Sachee Patisaaheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The warehouse of the True King is never deficient.
Cultivating the True Guru, those who earn through Him get merged into His inexhaustible Being.
The company of the saints is manifestly great; one should always be in and with it.

lines.gurmukhi: cwvl iekqy sit n dUjI vwhIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaaval Ikatay Sati N Doojee Vaaheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Husk in the form of maya should be separated from the rice of life

lines.gurmukhi: jm dI PwhI kit dwid ielwhIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jam Dee Dhaahee Kati Daadi Ilaaheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With strokes of discipline during this very life.

lines.transliteration_english: Panjay Doot Sanghati Su Ddhayree Ddhaaheeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the five evil propensities, should be decimated.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI ijau hirhit su Kyq aumwhIAY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Jiu Harihati Su Khayti Oumaaheeai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the  water of well keeps the fields green, the field of the consciousness should be kept verdant (with the help of shabad).
The true guru

lines.gurmukhi: pUrw siqgur Awip n AlKu lKwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Pooraa Satiguru Aapi N Alakhu Lakhaavaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lord Himself is the true Guru who is imperceptible.

lines.gurmukhi: dyKY Qwip auQwip ijau iqsu BwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Daykhai Daapi Udaapi Jiu Tisu Bhaavaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Of His own will He Establishes or uproots.

lines.gurmukhi: lypu n puMin n pwip aupwie smwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Laypu N Pounni N Paapi Oupaai Samaavaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sin and virtue of creation and destruction do not touch Him at all.

lines.gurmukhi: lwgU vr n srwp n Awp jxwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Laagoo Varu N Saraap N Aap Janaavaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He never makes anybody notice Him and boons and curses do not stick to Him.
The true Guru recites the Word and unfolds the grandeur of that indescribable Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw jpu jwip n jgqu kmwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Japu Jaapi N Jagatu Kamaavaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eulogosong the ineffable (Lord) he does not indulge in hypocrisy and guile.
The effulgence of the perfect Guru finishes off the ego of the seekers of knowledge.
The Guru effacing the three suferings (god-sent, physical and spiritual) lessens the anxieties of the people.

lines.gurmukhi: gurbwxI mn DRwip inj Gir AwveI ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurabaanee Man Dhraapi Nij Ghari Aavaee ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting satiated by the teachings of such a Guru, the individual stays in his innate nature.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 guris`KwN leI swDn, dSw qy vrqn

Shabad OS B.translation: Means for the Sikhs,their state and conduct  ,
The perfect Guru is truth incarnate who is realised by becoming gurmukh.
The desire of the true Guru is that the Word should be sustained;
Burning the ego one will get honour in the court of Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Gr hI jog jugiq bYsix DrmswlIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Hee Jog Jougati Baisani Dharamasaaleeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One should learn the technique of merging in the Lord by considering one’s home as the place for cultivating dharma.

lines.gurmukhi: pwvn moK mukiq gur isiK pwlIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Paavan Mokh Moukati Gur Sikhi Paaleeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Liberation for them is certain who abide by the teaching of the Guru.
They having loving devotion in their heart remain jubliant.
Such people are emperors full of delight.
Becoming egoless  they serve the sangat, congregation, by bringing water, grinding corn etc. for it.
In humility and joy they lead altogether distinct life.
Characteristics of gurmukhs
The Guru preaches to the Sikh to be pure in conduct.
He (gurmukh) joining the congregation remains absorbed in the Word.
In the company of flowers the sesame oil also becomes scented.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK nk nkyl imtY AMdyisAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Nak Nakayl Mitai Andaysiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nose – string of God’s Will remains in the nose of the Sikh of the Guru i.e. he always keeps himself ready to be  subservient to the Lord.
Taking bath in the ambrosial hours he remains enrapt in the region of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gur jp irdY suhyl gur prvyisAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Japu Ridai Suhaylu Gur Paravaysiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Remembering Guru in his heart he becomes one with Him.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq Bau Byl swD sryisAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Bhau Bhaylu Saadh Saraysiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He having the fear of the Lord and a loving devotion, is known as the sadhu of high stature.

lines.gurmukhi: inq inq nvl nvyl gurmuiK ByisAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nit Nit Naval Navayl Guramoukhi Bhaysiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fast colour of the Lord goes on compounding on a gurmukh.
The gurmukh only remains with the supreme Lord who is the giver of supreme delight and fearlessness.
The dust of the feet

lines.gurmukhi: gur mUriq kir iDAwn sdw hjUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Moorati Kari Dhiaan Sadaa Hajoor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Concentrate upon the Guru-word considering it as the figure of the Guru who is always with you.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sbd igAwnu nyiV n dUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sabadu Giaanu Nayrhi N Door Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to the knowledge of the Word, the gurmukh finds the Lord always near and not far off.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrb ilKq nIswn krm AMkUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Purabi Likhatu Neesaanu Karam Ankoor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the seed of karmas aprouts according to the previous karmas.

lines.gurmukhi: gur syvw prDwn syvk sUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sayvaa Paradhaanu Sayvak Soor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The valiant servant becomes leader in doing service to the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn prm inDwn sd BrpUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Param Nidhaan Sad Bharapoor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: God, the supreme store house is always full and omnipresent.

lines.gurmukhi: swD sMgiq AsQwn jgmg nUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Asadaanu Jag Mag Noor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: His glory shines forth in the holy congregation of the saints.

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK ssIAr Bwnu ikrn TrUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Saseear Bhaanu Kirani Tdaroor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The brightness of myriads of moons and suns is subdued before the light of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK byd purwix kIrqn cUr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Bayd Puraani Keeratan Choor Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of Vedas and Puranas are insignificant before the praises of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq vCl prvwxu crxw DUr hY ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Vachhal Paravaanu Charanaa Dhoor Hai ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: The dust of the feet of the beloved of the Lord is dear to the gurmukh.
Oneness of the Guru and the Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKu isKu gur soie AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhu Sikhu Gur Soi Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being one with each other the Guru and the Sikh have made the Lord  perceptible (in the form of Guru).

lines.gurmukhi: gur dIiKAw lY isK isKu sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Deekhiaa Lai Sikhi Sikhu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting initiated by the Guru the disciple has become a Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK ie`ko hoie jo gur BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Iko Hoi Jo Gur Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It was the Lord’s desire that the Guru and the disciple would become one.
It seems as if the diamond cutting the diamond has brought the other one in one string;
Or the wave of water has merged in water, or the light of one lamp has come to reside in another lamp.
The wondrous deed (of the Lord) seems to have been transformed into a parable.
It is as if the sacred ghee has been produced after churning the curd.
The One Light has scattered in all the three worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: iek cwnxu qiHu loie pRgtI AwieAw ]11]

Shabad OS B.translation: It is as if the sacred ghee has been produced after churning the curd. The
Oneness of the Guru and the Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur nwnk dyau gurw guru hoieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Naanak Dayu Guraa Guru Hoiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The True Guru Nanak Dev was the Guru of Gurus.
He installed Guru Angad Dev on the invisible abd mysterious throne of equipoise.
Merging Amar Das into the external Lord he made him see the invisible.
Guru Ram  Das was made to quaff the delight of supreme nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: gur Arjn kir syau FoAY FoieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Arajan Kari Sayu Ddhoai Ddhoiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Arjan Dev got the largess of service (from Guru Ram Das).

lines.gurmukhi: guru hir goibMdu Amyau Aimau ivloieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Hari Gobind Amayu Amiu Viloiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Hargobind also churned the sea (of Word)
And due to the grace of all these truthful personalities, the truth of the Lord has come to reside in the hearts of common people, who have fully devoted their selves to the Word.
Even empty hearts of the people have been filled by sabad, the Word

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK ABr Bryau Brm Bau KoieAw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukh Abhar Bharayu Bharam Bhau Khoiaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: And the Gurmukhs have exterminated their fears and delusions.
Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq Bau Bwau shju bYrwg hY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Bhau Bhaau Sahaju Bairaagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fear (of God) and love (for mankind) being diffused in the holy congregation the sense of non-attachment always prevails.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK shij suBwau suriq su jwgu hY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sahaji Soubhaau Surati Su Jaagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By nature, the Gurmukhs  remian alert i.e. their consciousness remains attuned to Sabad, the Word.

lines.gurmukhi: mDur bcn Awlwau haumY iqAwg hY
lines.transliteration_english: Madhur Bachan Aalaau Haoumai Tiaagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They speak sweet words and they have already expelled ego from their  selves.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur miq prQwau sdw Anurwgu hY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Mati Paradaau Sadaa Anuraagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conducting themselves according to the wisdom of the Guru they always remain imbued in love (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwly swau msqik Bwg hY
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalay Saau Masataki Bhaagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They feeling fortunate quaff the cup of love (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: bHm joiq bHmwau igAwnu crwgu hY
lines.transliteration_english: Braham Joti Brahamaau Giaanu Charaagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Realising the light of the Supreme in their  mind they become competent to light the lamp of divine knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqir gurmiq cwau Ailpqu Adwgu hY
lines.transliteration_english: Antari Guramati Chaau Alipatu Adaagu Hai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due  to the wisdom obtained from Guru they have unlimited enthusiasm and  they remain untouched by maya and the dirt of the evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh cVHwau sdw suhwgu hY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Charhhaau Sadaa Suhaagu Hai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the context of worldliness, they always conduct themselves in a superior position i.e. if the world is twenty, they are twenty one.
Gurmukh
The words of gurmukh should always be cherished in one’s heart.
By the  benevolent glance of the gurmukh one becomes blest and happy.
Rare are those who attain the sense of discipline and service.
Gurmukhs being full of love are kind to the poor.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK inbhY nwil gur isK pwlIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Nibahai Naali Gur Sikh Paaleeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh is ever steadfast and always adheres to the teachings of the Guru.
One should seek jewels and rubies from the gurmukhs.
Gurmukhs are devoid of deception; they, without becoming victim of Time, go on enjoying the delight of devotion.
Gurmukhs have discriminatory wisdom of swans (who can separate milk from water), and they with their mind and body love their Lord.
Mystery of the Mulmantr
By writing 1 (One) in the beginning, it has been shown that Ekankar, God, who subsumes all forms in Him is only one (and not two or three).
Ura,  the first Gurmukhi letter, in the form of Oankar shows the world controlling power of that one Lord.
That Lord has been understood as the True-Name, Creator and the Fearless One.
He is devoid of rancour, beyond time and free from the cycle of transmigration.
Hail the Lord! His mark is truth and He shines in bright effulgent flame.
Five letters (1 Oankar) are altruists; they have in them the power of the person of the Lord.
The individual, understanding their import becomes blest with graceful glance of God who is the essence of delights.

lines.gurmukhi: nau AMig suMn sumwr sMig inrwilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Angi Sounn Soumaaru Sangi Niraaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the numerals from one to nine adding zero with them reach to the infinite count
The persons who quaff the cup of love from their beloved become master of infinite powers.
Unity among the four varnas
The people of all the four varnas sit together in the company of gurmukhs.
All the disciples become gurmukh as betel leaf, lime and chatehu when mixed become of one red colour.
All the five sounds (produced by different instruments) keep the gurmukhs full of joy.
In the waves of the Word of the true Guru, gurmukhs ever remain in delight.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq prsMg igAwn sMg myilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Parasang Giaan Sang Mayliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Joining their consciousness to the Guru’s teachings, they become knowledgeable.
They keep themselves absorbed day and night in the great resonance of Gurbani, the holy hymns.
Drowned into the infinite Word and its steadfast colour only the One (God) is realised.
Out of the twelve ways (of yogis) the way of the gurmukhs is the correct way.
Collyrium of the Gursikhs
In the primordial times the Lord ordained.
The Word of the Guru met with the Sabda-brahm Word-God and the ego of creatures got erased.
This  very awe-inspiring word is the collyrium of gurmukhs.
Adopting Gurmat, the wisdom of the Guru, with the grace of the Guru, the delusions are  eschewed.
That primordial being is beyond time and destruction.
He  bestows grace upon His servants like Siva and Sanaks et al.

lines.gurmukhi: jpIAY jughu jugwid gur isK mMjno
lines.transliteration_english: Japeeai Jougahu Jougaadi Gur Sikh Manjano.

Shabad OS B.translation: In all the ages only He is remembered and He alone is the object of concentration of the Sikhs.
Through the taste of the cup of love that Supreme Love is known.
Since the primordial time He has been delighting all.
The true disciple

lines.gurmukhi: murdw hoie murId n glI hovxw
lines.transliteration_english: Muradaa Hoi Mureedu N Galee Hovanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only by becoming dead in life, i.e. totally detached, and not through mere verbal jargon one can become a true disciple.

lines.gurmukhi: swbru isdik shIdu Brm Bau Kovxw
lines.transliteration_english: Saabaru Sidaki Saheedu Bharam Bhau Khovanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One could be such a person only after getting sacrificed for truth and contentment and by eschewing delusions and fears.
The true disciple is a boughten slave who is ever busy in the service of the Master.

lines.gurmukhi: nw iqsu BuK n nId n Kwxw sovxw
lines.transliteration_english: Naa Tisu Bhoukh N Need N Khaanaa Sovanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He forgets hunger, sleep, food and rest.
He  grinds fresh flour (for free kitchen) and serves by fetching water.

lines.gurmukhi: pKy dI qwgId pg mil Dovxw
lines.transliteration_english: Pakhay Dee Taageed Pag Mali Dhovanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He fans (the congregation) and washes nicely the feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: syvk hoie sMjIdu n hsx rovxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sayvak Hoi Sanjeedu N Hasanu Rovanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The servant  always remains disciplined and has nothing to do with wailing and laughing.

lines.gurmukhi: dr drvys rsIdu iprm rs Bovxw
lines.transliteration_english: Dar Daravays Raseedu Piram Rasu Bhovanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This way he becomes dervish at the door of the Lord and gets drenched in the delights of the rains of love.
He will be seen as the first moon of Id day (which the Muslims eagerly wait for in order to break their long fasts), and only he will come out as a perfect man.
What is demanded of a disciple  ?

lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Mureedai Theevanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming the dust of the feet the disciple is required to be near the feet of the the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gur mUriq musqwku mir mir jIvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Moorati Mousataaku Mari Mari Jeevanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming an avid suiter of the form (word) of the Guru and being dead to greed, infatuation and other relational propensities, he should remain alive in the world.
Repudiating all worldly connections he must remain dyed in the colour of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: hor n JKxu Jwk srix mnu sIvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Hor N Jhakhanu Jhaak Sarani Manu Seevanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeking no shelter elsewhere he should keep his mind absorbed in the shelterof God, the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw pwk AimA rsu pIvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalaa Paak Amia Rasu Peevanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sacred is the cup of the love of the beloved; he should quaff that only.
Making humility his abode he should get poised in it.
Divorcing the (tastes of ) ten organs i.e.not being caught in their dragnet, he should attain equipose.

lines.gurmukhi: swvDwn gur vwk n mn BrmIvxw
lines.transliteration_english: Saavadhaan Gur Vaak N Man Bharameevanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He must be fully conscious about the word of Guru and should not allow the mind to be entrapped in delusions.
Absorption of consciousness in the Word makes  him alert and this way one gets across the Word – ocean.
Who is the acknowledged Sikh   ?
He is true Sikh who surrenders before the Guru and bows his head;

lines.gurmukhi: gur crxI icqu lwie mQw lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Charanee Chitu Laai Madaa Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who puts his mind and forehead on the feet of Guru;
Who holding dear to his heart the teachings of the Guru expels ego from his self;
Who loves the will of Lord and has attained equipoise by becoming Guru-oriented, gurmukh;

lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Liv Laai Houkamu Kamaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who by merging his consciousness in the Word has acted according to the divine Will (hukam).

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq BY Bwie inj Gir pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Bhai Bhaai Nij Gharu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (the true Sikh) as the result of his love and fear of holy congregation attains his own self (atma).
He remains stuck to the lotus feet of the Guru like the black bee.
Getting enveloped in this delight  he goes on quaffing the nectar.
Blessed is the mother of such a person. Only his coming to this world is fruitful.
One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the Grace of the divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: jgmg joiq srUp prm joiq iml joiq mih
lines.transliteration_english: Jagamag Joti Saroopa , Param Joti Mil Joti Mahi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The light eternal of Guru Nanak Dev melded into the light of Guru Angad Dev who acquired effulgence like the former.

lines.gurmukhi: AdBuq Aqih AnUp prm qqu qqih imilE ]1]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Adabhout Atahi Anoopa , Param Tatu Tatahi Miliao ?1?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: With the light of Guru Nanak merging with that of Guru Angad Dev Ji, the latter became wondrous in form and beyond words of praise.

lines.gurmukhi: prm joiq imil joiq mih jgmg joiq srUp
lines.transliteration_english: Param Joti Mili Joti Mahi , Jagamag Joti Saroop ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Light supreme (Guru Nanak Dev Ji) merged in Guru Angad Dev's light who himself became light divine.

lines.gurmukhi: prm qq qqih imilE AdBuq Aq hI AnUp ]2]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Param Tat Tatahi Miliao , Adabhout At Hee Anoop ?2?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Truth of Guru Nanak merged with the essence of Guru Angad transforming him into astonishing form.

lines.gurmukhi: AdBuq Aiq hI AnUp rUp pwrs kY pwrs
lines.transliteration_english: Adabhout Ati Hee Anoopa , Roop Paaras Kai Paaras ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Angad coming in contact with Guru Nanak the philosopher-stone, became a philosopher-stone himself. His form too became wondrous.

lines.gurmukhi: gur AMgd imil AMg sMg imil sMg auDwrs
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Angad Mili Anga , Sang Mili Sang Udhaaras ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming inseparable from Guru Nanak, Lehna Ji became Guru Angad and then whosoever came in touch with him (Guru Angad) was liberated.

lines.gurmukhi: Akl klw BrpUir sUqR giq Eiq poiq mih
lines.transliteration_english: Akal Kalaa Bharapoori , Sootr Gati Aoti Poti Mahi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Angad Ji integrated himself like warp and weft with Guru Nanak, the possessor of Divine power of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: jgmg joiq srUp joiq imil joiq joiq mih ]3]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Jagamag Joti Saroopa , Joti Mili Joti Joti Mahi ?3?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Light merged with light so much that whosoever came in contact with light embodiment (Guru Angad) , became resplendent too. (3)
